What are you gonna do?" *****************  I have volunteered to participate in a study for Avastin, but the study number is different from the one in the article (USO 07-132) and the number of total patients is different.  Thanks for the information as I will ask my oncologist if this effects my study.  If my oncologist feels that the risks are no greater than originally discussed then I think I will go ahead with the study.
Posts.Title: Starting chemo September 2009 krcll sanaisa

Posts.Content: Sep 25, 2009 03:46AM snuziq wrote: Unlkezwifeonty - I had a bard port put in yesterday.  The surgery only took 30 minutes or so and I had some pain yesterday, but today it was very manageble with medication.  I even went to work today - I sit at a desk most of the day so no real stress on my chest.  I hope yours goes as easliy as mine did. This is my first post to this topic as I have been "lurking" trying to decide if I belong in the September group or not.  My chemo starts on September 30th so I was trying to decided if I would have more in common with the October group.  You all are so supportive of each other, it is a wonderful thing to see and I would really like to join this group.
Posts.Title: Starting chemo September 2009 krcll sanaisa

Posts.Content: Sep 27, 2009 04:02PM snuziq wrote: Onty, I have my first treatment on Wednesday, so I haven't had any side effects other than the nerves associated with the unknown.  I will let you know what my Onco says when I ask about the other study.  Here's hoping for very few side effects! hugs!
